entry.title: Time off Finland - accrual rules and best practices package
entry.content:
Dear community, 

I'm coming to ask if there are customers actually being able to work with Time off in Finland, and having the accrual rules working correctly in the cases of parental leaves.. I've been checking the best practices solution deployed in 1H 2024 but this solution does not seem to fulfill the legal requirements. 1H 2024 Release Highlights of SAP Best Practices f... - SAP Community

@NeeleshKamath 

I've been working with a Finnish customer which claims the following legal requirement: Per child, the employee accumulates holidays for a maximum of 160 days of parental leave. This count is made Monday to Saturday. The moment the employee reaches that limit, he stops accumulating holidays in the months he is still absent due to the same child birth. The employee can take the parental leave until the child becomes 2 years old. 

This needs to work together with the Finnish 14 days rule : an employee accumulates holidays for a certain month as long as he has worked at least 14 days in a month. That can be controlled with rule functions "Get Number Of Working Days Or Hours For Period()" from accruable start date to accruable end date. (OK until there)

So what the Best Practices rule (SFCC_ACC_FIN_Holiday_Credit_Accruals)  does is the following: count parental leaves in deduction quantity up to 160 days (monday to saturdays), and from that moment, penalize the employee. In a month, we will get the working days MINUS the days above 160 to see if it is above/below 14 days for the accrual. This solution is never considering which child the absence is about (what if you have multiple children?) and never considering the 2 years period mentioned above (it is checking the 160 limit in the year). 

As a result: this would never work well in reality!

For example imagine an employee has parental leave (reaching 160 days) on the 28th of June 2025, and he is on parental leave until the 12th of july (Saturday).

According to the Best Practices rule, the working days in july are 23. 

The days exceeding 160 days are from the 1st of july until the 12th (in yellow), saturdays included = 11

23 minus 11 = 12 days. 12 days is below 14 days, so the employee should not be eligible to accumulate holidays in that month. 

But in reality the employee should accumulate holidays because: 

Working days = 23

Working Days absent due to parental leave = 9

23 minus 9 = 14 days. Equal or above to the 14 days limit. so he would accrue days for that month. 

The difference is mixing units: working days vs deduction quantity. And deduction quantity days could be even greater than the working days!

So, seriously, has any company been able to work with this successfully?

 

Thank you very much for your time

Laura

entry.title: Implementing OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the ‚ÄúSAP SuccessFactors‚Äù application, but the option only works when ‚ÄúAdministration Console‚Äù is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

  • We successfully called the /oauth2/token API and obtained an ID token from the Identity Authentication service.

  • We made a second API call to obtain an API access token using the ID token from the previous step.

  • However, using this access token, we are unable to access APIs in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Getting the 401 authentication error while querying SuccessFactors OData APIs:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

Key Requirements:

  • The official documentation suggests using grant_type=password, which we want to avoid for security reasons.

  • We intend to use grant_type=authorization_code so that users can log in via SSO through the front-end application, and their session can be used to access the APIs.

  • We would appreciate guidance on setting this up, specifically:

    1. How to configure the authentication flow for users logging in through the front-end application.

    2. How to configure it when an application (rather than users) needs to consume SuccessFactors APIs.

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande 

Regards,
Pavan

  • This entry replicates and throws an error

See example employee Zach Booth. This Rehire record appeared on his old employment record (the name one where his termination record is) before onboarding was completed.

entry.title: 2H 2025 SuccessFactors Release Schedule
entry.content:
2H 2025 SuccessFactors Release Dates

Key Dates: 2H 2025

MilestoneDate
Preview Release WindowOctober 13, 2025
Production Release WindowNovember 14-16, 2025
  • Preview is when the upcoming changes/features are available in non-productive instances so you can test.
  • Production is when changes go live in customer production environments.

SAP classifies new release items into four enablement categories:

  • Customer Configured ‚Üí Needs manual setup by the customer.

  • Contact Product Support ‚Üí Activation/troubleshooting by SAP Support.

  • Contact Enablement Partner ‚Üí Setup help from your partner.

  • Contact CEE / Account Manager ‚Üí Enabled via your SAP Contact Customer Engagement Executive or Account Manager.

  • Automatically On ‚Üí Delivered by default, no setup needed.

You need to align with your client or business stakeholders to determine which features should be adopted immediately and which should be put on hold for later.

With the 1H 2025 release, SAP SuccessFactors provides a clear framework to help customers understand how new features are enabled, what actions are required, and their lifecycle status.

 

DimensionCategoriesPurpose
Enablement
  • Customer Configured
  • Contact Product Support
  • Contact Enablement Partner
  • Contact CEE/Account Manager
  • Automatically On
Defines how a feature becomes available to you ‚Äì whether it requires manual configuration, assistance, or is enabled by default.

Actions

  • Info Only
  • Not Applicable
  • Recommended
  • Required
Explains what you need to do ‚Äì from awareness only, to mandatory adoption.
Lifecycle
  • General Availability
  • Deprecated
  • Deleted
Shows the current and future state of a feature ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs active, being phased out, or fully removed.

Regards,

Mahnoor Naseem

SAP SuccessFactors Consultant

entry.title: Enhancement Request: Duplicate Workflow Approvers
entry.content:
Please vote. 

Our company has a robust workflow approval process that often includes multiple layers of leadership‚ÄîVP, SVP, EVP‚Äîas well as HR Business Partners. In some cases, the same individual may appear in multiple approval roles (e.g., as both the direct manager and the VP), resulting in redundant approvals for the same position change.

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/356979

Proposal: Enhance the workflow logic to detect when an approver is already included in a previous step of the approval chain and automatically skip duplicate approvals for that individual.

Example Scenario:
A salaried position change requires approvals from:

  • Manager
  • Manager +1
  • VP
  • Executive
  • HRBP

If Adam is both the Manager and the VP, and Veronica is both Manager +1 and the Executive approver, the system should recognize these overlaps and skip redundant approvals.

entry.title: Help Needed with Accrual Rule for India ‚Äì Probation Period Handling
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, 

I need support with an accrual rule for India, where the probation period end date should be considered in the accrual logic.

Business scenario:

  • During the probation period, employees do not receive any Privilege Leave.

  • After the end of probation, employees are entitled to 1.25 days of Privilege Leave per month.

  • The confirmation of probation can occur on any day within the month.

Example:
An employee joins on 05.05.2024, and the probation period ends on 06.05.2025.
In this case, May 2025 should be included in the accrual calculation, since the confirmation occurs within the same month.

Current issue:

  • The current business rule excludes the probation confirmation month and begins accrual from the following month (e.g. from June in the above example).

  • After testing and some adjustments, we found that the rule only works correctly if the Job Information record starts on the 1st of the month or before the confirmation date.

    • In that case, the confirmation month is correctly included in the accrual calculation.

Question:

Is there any way to include the probation confirmation month in the accrual logic even if the confirmation date is not on the 1st of the month? Can this be achieved by configuring the business rule differently or by using a workaround?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you and best reagrds

Thiphawan
